website_summaries.verdict: The Canon imageFormula P-215II Scan-tini Personal Document Scanner is designed to be portable, but it's capable enough to serve as a personal desktop scanner as well.
cons: Relatively big and heavy for a portable scanner
Application programs do not install by default

customer_reviews.title: No good for MacBooks, no longer supported by Canon.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 18 months ago and was quite happy with it, used it with my MacBook no problems, did a good job. Unfortunately since the recent High Sierra upgrade it won't work. Canon website says it is no longer supported so I would therefore recommend you do not buy it if you are in the world of Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Trainer of Angels

customer_reviews.title: A great all-round document scanner
customer_reviews.text: A great document feed scanner. It is quite compact and well designed. I don't intend using it much on the go but makes a great addition to a flatbed scanner for all those loose A4 sheets of whatever you need to scan. It is very quick and the user interfaces are easy to configure for one touch scanning. I just have it connected via one USB cable, it seems to run fine without the additional power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a dental practice. Swayed for this, as the reviews for a similar one (Fujitsu) correctly states need to check what is it compatible with. This snap scanner is compatible with twain which means you can use it with your preferred software ie for us Software of excellence Exact
customer_reviews.author: B. Wahid

customer_reviews.title: Canon imageFORMULA P-215II
customer_reviews.text: In the past I have used several portable scanners, but the Canon imageFORMULA P-215II is the best. Once the software, (Twain Drivers) had been loaded on my computer it worked seamlessly with ABBYY FineReader Pro. Powered from a usb port, it's fast even scanning at 600 dpi. 'wings' on the adjustable paper guides prevent any paper 'skewing' etc. A nice piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compact Desktop Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant compact desktop scanner. It takes a while to understand the different options but well worth the effort. It will only scan single sheets and not pages from books. Scans photographs very well. An excellent scanner if you want to scan your statements, invoices, etc on to your computer instead of filing away hard copies. Great for a small home office especially if you have little desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Auto Feeder Useless
customer_reviews.text: This scanner regularly feeds multiple sheets in one go. So I have to repeatedly pull the remaining sheets out and start again. Almost every attempt to scan anything over 4 pages causes multiple sheets to be picked up at the same time. Really disappointed. I'd expect something with this price to feed properly.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Not very quick, but very quiet! Sometimes it feeds extra pages so have to observe it all the time while scanning. I love the software coming with it, very easy to use and straight forward. I also love the fact it automatically rotates the pages and the scanning quality is really good.I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Antoniya Beyriyska

customer_reviews.title: Clear bright prints
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are not clear so it’s pot luck whether it works or not but when it does it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: Jean smith

customer_reviews.title: Recommend as a DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work despite software downloaded and correct connections. Instructions muddled. Why do we have to put up with products like these in a technologically advanced world? Wasted hours trying to connect scanner which should have been a simple & straightforward job. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: delete my profile

customer_reviews.title: Still the best Compact in the Market
customer_reviews.text: I Have purchased 6 or seven of these at least over the years for myself and work colleagues. They are ideal for the 'mobile office'. Unbelievable that you can scan double sided unlike an A4 Flatbed or other Portable Scanners that I have researched and scans as fast if not faster as a big desktop scanner The software is very intuitive and easy to use yet gives you functions for editing, renaming, document sorting and many other customisable. Its more expensive than some, but the best value for money
customer_reviews.author: Ornithologist

customer_reviews.title: Not for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: Canon have stopped supporting this product on Mac OS. They probably support an older Mac OS but don't for Mojave at least. Kind of crappy of them. Their advice is to buy a new product or not upgrade OS if you don't want to lose scanner. I for one expect my peripheral devices to keep up with my PC, not the other way around. So, unless you use an old Mac OS and are happy to stay like that - this scanner does not seem worth it at this time. Will probably avoid canon for now.
customer_reviews.author: MrDave

customer_reviews.title: Good: Portable
customer_reviews.text: Good: Portable, time saving (when it works) especially for double-sided scans and a doddle to setup. I have tried it on Windows 7, 8.1. I've opted not to install any software to make use of it, just onTouch software that comes with it. I bought it at it's much higher price over 18 months ago. However the downside is: it can't seem to keep paper straight as it feeds itself some of the time. That really lets it down. If you can get a few extra pounds together check out Fuji scanSnap...
customer_reviews.author: N. Ahmed
